title.narrative: WASH in Schools Management Improvement Project in Zambia

description.narrative: 2.440 boys and 2.397 girls at 9 schools in Chembe District, Luapula Programme Unit in Zambia

By ensuring that boys and girls at 9 schools have access to adequate child friendly water supply and sanitation facilities with hand washing including provision of Hygiene education, (morbidity) rates of diarrhoea and other diseases caused by a lack of access to safe WASH will be reduced.
To support provision of appropriate (child-friendly), adequate (sufficient quantity) and well-maintained WASH facilities at schools that include consideration for children with special needs (including girls during menstruation and students with physical disabilities); And provision of health and hygiene education, as part of a broader goal to improve health and learning outcomes.

F Parent Teachers Association/Community will make payments for spare parts and the services of area mechanics. The Elected Water Committee mobilizes financial community contributions. I Built the results into the government appraisal procedure. Maintenance will be done according to the agreed national Sustainable Operation and Maintenance Approach (SOMAp) that Plan International Zambia has been part of its development . Local Authority/D-WASHE will be trained and made responsible for monitoring. Also a Water Committee will be elected. E The Elected Water Committee works closely with the Environmental Health Technologists (EHTs), other extension officers and the Ward Development Committee (WDC) on development. T In their application for the WASH facilities, the communities have demonstrated their plan to own the operations and maintenance works 100%. The Elected Water Committee supervises the construction works including the drilling of the borehole to understand technicalities involved in drilling and installation of hand pumps before handover. S A parent teachers association/community will be established which will monitor the local authority, plan the monitoring and inspect the facilities, and resolution of conflicts. The Elected Water Committee will also mobilizes other community contributions as labor and material.

In Zambia, the Government through the Ministry of General Education (MoGE) works with several partners to improve school sanitation and hygiene practices among school pupils, including USAID, Water Aid, PLAN International, SNV, UNICEF, World Vision, GIZ and DGIS (Netherlands). The partners are working in partnership with Ministry of Education, Science, Vocation Training and Early Education (MESVTEE) and Ministry of Water Development, Sanitation and Environmental Protection (MWDSEP) to improve sanitation and hygiene practices in over 1,500 schools across all districts. Zone teachers, Environmental Health Technologists and Community Development Assistants, including selected key district staff i.e. District Water, Sanitation and Hygiene Education (D-WASHE) members are also involved and play an important role in achieving the results. In the schools Teachers and Parent Association members also actively contribute.

In the selected project area most schools lack adequate WASH facilities. Especially in remote schools the situation is serious. For children with special needs it is even more challenging to attend the schools. The project will improve the WASH situation in 9 remote schools.

SUMMARY Defective WASH systems can easily serve as hubs for transmission of faecal-oral diseases which exert negative impacts on children’s physical and cognitive development. In the project, nine marginalised remote schools have been identified because of the lack of safe WASH facilities. Also amongst these students, are children with special needs. The overall objective is to ensure that boys and girls have access to adequate child friendly water supply, sanitation and handwashing facilities including provision of hygiene education. Plan is implementing the project in cooperation with district government officials, Elected Water Committee and Parent Teachers Association. The project is carried out in Chembe District and has started on 1-6-2016. It creates an enabling environment that provides the foundation for a scalable programme. An important activity is the focus on the realization of change in behaviour and to contribute to lasting outcomes for child health and education.
